description: "On 24 March the government of Antigua and Barbuda announced with immediate effect the consolidation of its maritime border on the island of Antigua. All international maritime arrivals must enter via Nevis Street Pier in St John’s." "Yachts are not permitted to enter Antigua and Barbuda, regardless of which country they have arrived from, and regardless of the nationality or residential status of those on board. Travellers arriving from Montserrat are being screened, which may result in extended travel time."

description: The Government of Antigua and Barbuda allowed a relaxation of the nationwide business restrictions on 16th of April:"Among the essential services added to the list allowed to operate were hardware stores, mechanics, and chandleries to enable yachts to stock up on marine supplies. Dentists may now treat patients but must pay extra special care to decontaminating their instruments, Cabinet warned. Supermarkets are being encouraged to operate online sales and deliveries but will remain open from 7am until 12pm. Banks and other financial institutions may also open daily for the same five-hour period.Mechanics can operate as needed, while automobile spare parts stores may also operate online, telephone and delivery services."
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Retail Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The Government of Antigua and Barbuda allowed a relaxation of the nationwide business restrictions on 16th of April:
"Among the essential services added to the list allowed to operate were hardware stores, mechanics, and chandleries to enable yachts to stock up on marine supplies. Dentists may now treat patients but must pay extra special care to decontaminating their instruments, Cabinet warned. Supermarkets are being encouraged to operate online sales and deliveries but will remain open from 7am until 12pm. Banks and other financial institutions may also open daily for the same five-hour period.
Mechanics can operate as needed, while automobile spare parts stores may also operate online, telephone and delivery services." UPDATE: From April the 16th on, some more businesses are allowed to open. Those include hardware stores, mechanics, and chandleries to enable yachts to stock up on marine supplies. Previously, only the most relevant businesses were allowed to remain open.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Retail Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description: "No person shall–host or attend at any private party which includes any person from outside of his or her immediate household occupant; attend or participate in any organised sporting event or any sports stadium; hold any banquet, ball or reception; any social event. For the duration of the curfew period –weddings; meeting of a fraternal society, social or private club, civic organisation or association,are banned. Funerals, if held during the curfew period, must be conducted in the cemetery with no more than ten mourners, the  officiant,  two  representative  from  the  funeral  home  and  two  persons  employed  to  work  in  the  graveyard,  all  of whom shall practice social distancing and wear a face mask." UPDATE: From the 2nd of April, all gatherings in Antigua and Barbuda are prohibited. Funerals are the only exceptions.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: Antigua and Barbuda, May 14. The government announced that churches are free to conduct rituals (baptisms, confirmations, weddings and funerals) with the social distancing rules enforced, and no more than 25 persons in the sanctuary all wearing masks. The churches are to submit their protocols for consideration, which protocols will govern the holding of their regular Saturday and Sunday services.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description:
"Prison visits and court cases across Antigua and Barbuda are suspended for two weeks to reduce the risk of coronavirus (COVID-19) transmissions. The Ministry said the suspension of prison visits also affects food and water drop-offs for inmates. Only the Prison Farm Gang members can enter and leave Her Majesty’s Prison. At the courts, some trials that have already started will continue and emergency applications heard but the Magistrates Court will continue to function under a very strict regulatory regime.
The Civil Registry will operate a next day service, where a drop box will be provided for drop-offs, while emergency applications will be facilitated.
Only three people will be allowed to enter the Land Registry and Intellectual Property Departments at a time.
The Legal Aid and Advice Centre will also be limiting public contact to one person per session. Scheduled interview sessions will be done via telephone and a drop off box will be provided for required documents."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: A statement by the Antigua Public Utility Authority informed the public about social distancing and hygiene measures on March 16th. "Senior citizens will be given priority in customer lines, to limit exposure, controlled lines at our payment centers will be enforced, utilization of sanitization stationswill be made compulsory upon entrance of offices, a designated waiting area will be provided to facilitate the recommended social distance."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: Even though the Government of Antigua and Barbuda introduced a curfew before, the official statement published on April 22 included detailed social distancing rules for businesses, which are allowed to open during the curfew. "Ensure that all customers and staff maintain physical distancing of no less than six feet in or around their business; determine the number of persons that may be permitted in the establishment at any one time by permitting one person for every fifty square feet of store space; place distance markers at six feet interval showing where persons are permitted to stand at a check out point; place distance markers at six feet interval to show where persons are permitted to stand while waiting outside of the establishment"
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
